column4: Have a question, I screwed up my home directory somehow which affected my gnome-panel, I changed the path and did killall gnome-panel and everything disappeared. Is there a way to reset my home directory path through a terminal?
what do you mean by changed path?
I changed the path from /home/neoprodigy to /media/home
in the Users and Group tool
I seem to remember this info being stored in a file somewhere
ok, thanks, i will take a look see
Nothing in the /etc/profile or ~/.bashrc that helps me change the path for my home directory
oh, stupid me, you changed the path to you home :) wait a min
i'll take a look at the man, thanks for pointing the direction
that's what i'm looking for! thanks!
